function_reachability: Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'print'?
Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'print'?
Is it impossible for function 'select_sort' to reach function 'print'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i < n - 1' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i < n - 1' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'j < n' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'j < n' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < n - 1' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'j < n' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'a (line 2)' affect subsequent computations?
Is variable 'n (line 2)' used after its definition?
liveness: Does variable 'n (line 2)' remain in use at the end of function 'print'?
Is variable 'a (line 2)' live at the end of function 'print'?
dead_code: Can the program actually reach the statement: “int i, j, temp, min;”?
